column4: This medication is used to treat severe allergic reactions, such as anaphylaxis, which can be life-threatening.

Antibiotics are used to treat bacterial infections and are considered high priority when treating serious infections such as pneumonia, meningitis, sepsis, and infections in immunocompromised patients.
Anticoagulants are medications used to prevent blood clots and are considered high priority in treating conditions such as deep vein thrombosis (DVT) and pulmonary embolism.

These are medications that contain antibodies and are used to treat autoimmune diseases, immune deficiencies, and some infections. They are considered high priority in treating severe infections and immune-related disorders.
Insulin is used to treat diabetes, a chronic condition that can lead to serious health complications if not managed properly.
Chemotherapy drugs are used to treat cancer and are considered high priority due to the life-threatening nature of the disease.
Narcan is a medication used to reverse the effects of an opioid overdose and is considered high priority in the current opioid epidemic.
Antiviral medications are used to treat viral infections such as influenza, hepatitis, and HIV and are considered high priority in treating these serious conditions.

Pain management medications such as opioids are considered high priority in managing acute pain, such as post-surgery pain, or in treating chronic pain in patients who cannot manage their pain with other therapies.
